intro: Strobilanthes bogoriensis, commonly known as the Bornean flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is adapted to high humidity and partial shade. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
